page.title: 18BELLERBY SCHOOL EXHIBITION 2
page.content: Over 150 people visited the exhibition, among them the two oldest surviving former pupils, both now living in Leyburn, and a retired teacher who taught at Bellerby for 44 years. The older children at present attending the school were responsible for writing down the recollections of school life in the past by former pupils and the younger children gave a display of how clothes were washed in great grandma's time. As well as marking the closure of the school, the purpose of the exhibition was to jog memories and provide an opportunity for people to meet and talk over times past. This was so successful that the village plans to repeat the exhibition in the Memorial Hall in the autumn.
